briefTitle: ERADICATE Hp2 - Treating Helicobacter Pylori With RHB-105 Compared to Active Comparator

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Eradication of H. Pylori
outcomeMeasures.description: Eradication of H. pylori confirmed via 13C Urea Breath Test (UBT) testing. Subjects with negative test results (eradication of H. pylori) were considered treatment successes. Subjects who tested positive for H. pylori infection (no eradication) were considered treatment failures.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With H. Pylori Cultures That Presented Antibiotic Resistance and Susceptibility
outcomeMeasures.description:
The primary endpoint was summarized within subgroups formed by the presence of H. pylori susceptibility and resistance to amoxicillin, clarithromycin, metronidazole, and rifabutin from H. pylori cultures from samples obtained prior to initiating study treatment (i.e. baseline).

A participant is considered a responder when H. pylori is eradicated after treatment as confirmed via 13C Urea Breath Test (UBT). A participant is considered a non-responder when H. pylori is not eradicated after treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events That Are Related to Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: The number of participants that presented treatment emergent adverse events (TEAE) during the study overall, TEAEs related to study drug and severe TEAEs.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Eradication of H. Pylori in the Pharmacokinetic Population (PKP)
outcomeMeasures.description:
A pre-specified responder analysis of eradication of H. pylori confirmed via 13C Urea Breath Test (UBT) was performed in the PK population.

The PK population was generated based on the measurement of plasma concentrations of amoxicillin, omeprazole, rifabutin, and the rifabutin metabolite 25-O-desacetyl-rifabutin (on Day 13). It included those subjects in the FAS who had demonstrable presence of any component of investigational drug at Visit 3 or had no levels detected \>250 hours after the last dose. For all subjects, the reason for exclusion from the PKP was the absence of any pharmacokinetic component of study drug at Visit 3 within 250 hours of the last reported dose. Two hundred fifty hours was selected to account for approximately 10 times the terminal half-life of rifabutin.
